summary: IBD is an immunosuppressive disease caused by infectious bursal disease virus. it can infect immature B-lymphocytes in the bursa of Fabricius. maternal immunity and active immunity can protect chicks against IBDV infection. chicken has different repertoire of immunity genes, molecules, cells, and tissues. chicken lacks lymph nodes, but has bursa of fabricius and cecum tonsil. avian immunity is relatively lagging compared with the mouse, human, and swine. bacillus saerimneri (L. sae) has the ability to colonize the chicken intestine.
